overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to strengthen state fireworks laws. [10] Specifically, the measure amends various definitions relating to fireworks, increases certain penalties for fireworks offenses, establishes various criminal offenses and penalties, establishes processes relating to the adjudication of fireworks infractions, and appropriates moneys. [10] Your Committee believes that this measure appropriately addresses shortcomings in the current regulatory framework and establishes a sensible penalty structure. [10]
appropriations: The measure appropriates moneys. [10] <previous section>The previous fiscal note specified an appropriation of an unspecified sum for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 to be expended by the judiciary, but the current committee report does not contain these details.</previous section>
assumptions_and_methodology: The Committee recognizes the need to reform the State's approach to enforcing fireworks laws. [10] This measure is assumed to appropriately address shortcomings in the current regulatory framework. [10] It also establishes a sensible penalty structure that imposes just consequences based on the severity of violations. [10]
agency_impact: Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of the Attorney General, Honolulu Police Department, Hawaii County Police Department, and the Department of the Prosecuting Attorney, County of Maui. [10] The Hawaiian Humane Society and four individuals also submitted supportive comments. [10] Written comments in opposition to this measure were received from Hawaii Explosives and Pyrotechnics and one individual. [10]

[10] It also establishes a sensible penalty structure that imposes just consequences based on the severity of violations. updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: This fiscal note is based on the report from the Committee on Ways and Means, which confirms the measure's intent but lacks the specific financial details present in the previous fiscal note.
